trans-unit.source: When overridden in a derived form, provides functionality for tasks.
This abstract class provides default implementations for the methods and properties of the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITask> interface.
This class can only be instantiated in a derived form.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Task"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Task"></xref> class with the specified <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Task.TaskResources*>.
This constructor allows derived task classes to register their resources.
The task resources.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Task"></xref> class with the specified <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Task.TaskResources*> and <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Task.HelpKeywordPrefix*>.
This constructor allows derived task classes to register their resources, as well as provide a prefix for composing help keywords from string resource names.
If `helpKeywordPrefix` is an empty string, string resource names will be used verbatim as help keywords.
The task resources.
The prefix to append to string resources to create Help keywords.
Gets or sets the instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Framework.IBuildEngine"></xref> object used by the task.
The build engine automatically sets this property to allow tasks to call back into it.
The <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Framework.IBuildEngine"></xref> available to tasks.
Gets the instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Framework.IBuildEngine2"></xref> object used by the task.
The <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Framework.IBuildEngine2"></xref> available to tasks.
Gets the instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Framework.IBuildEngine3"></xref> object used by the task.
The <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Framework.IBuildEngine3"></xref> available to tasks.
Gets the instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Framework.IBuildEngine4"></xref> object used by the task.
Returns the <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Framework.IBuildEngine4"></xref> available to tasks.
When overridden in a derived class, executes the task.
This class must be overridden in a derived class, and is used for performing task execution logic.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the task successfully executed; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the prefix used to compose Help keywords from resource names.
If a task does not have Help keywords associated with its messages, it can ignore this property or set it to `null`.
If this property is set to an empty <xref:System.String>, resource names will be used verbatim as Help keywords.
The prefix used to compose Help keywords from resource names.
Gets or sets the host object associated with the task.
If the host IDE has associated a host object with this particular task, then the build engine sets this property.
The host object is provided by <xref:Microsoft.Build.Execution.HostServices>.
Visual Studio determines the host object via a system registry key.
For more information, see <xref:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsMSBuildHostObject>.
The host object associated with the task.
This value can be <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Gets an instance of a <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Utilities.TaskLoggingHelper"></xref> class containing task logging methods.
The logging helper object.
Gets or sets the culture-specific resources associated with the task.
If derived classes have localized strings, then they should register their resources either during construction, or through this property.
The culture-specific resources associated with the task.
This value can be <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
